Sure, I can provide you some examples of hymns and devotional songs that are commonly sung during Goan Christian religious ceremonies. 

1. Canticles – Goan Christian communities sing Canticles during Mass. These are religious songs that provide praise and worship to God. Some of the most popular Canticles in Goa include Magnificat, Benedictus, and Nunc Dimittis.

2. Liturgical Music – Liturgical music refers to the music that is performed during the Mass. The music is usually in Konkani and Portuguese, and the choir sings it. Goan communities have a rich tradition of singing hymns during the Mass, and some of the popular hymns include "Anugraha" and "Karuna Saagar."

3. Carol Songs – Goan Christian communities also sing carol songs during Christmas. The songs are usually in Konkani or Portuguese and are accompanied by various instruments like the guitar, piano, and harmonium. Some popular carol songs in Goa include "Joy to the World," "Silent Night," and "Hark! The Herald Angels Sing."

4. Christian Devotional Music – Christian devotional music is popular in Goa and is usually in Konkani. These songs offer praise and worship to God and are commonly played during religious events like Novenas and Celebrations. Some popular Christian Devotional songs in Goa include "Jezucho Mog," "Sukhachem Soinnem," and "Tujea Vella Fakir."

In summary, hymns and devotional songs in Goan Christian Religious Ceremonies are usually in Konkani or Portuguese and served to provide praise and worship to God. These songs have been passed down through generations and reflect the rich musical and cultural heritage of Goan communities.
